Our Initiatives

King Philanthropies is inspired by the generous spirit of its founders Bob & Dottie King

Learn More

Stanford Seed

—

Global Poverty is one of the most pressing challenges of our time and Bob and Dottie King are determined to use their resources to alleviate it.

View Initiative

View Initiative

King Scholars Leadership Program

—

The King Scholars program is built on a simple premise: poverty alleviation can be best achieved by those who have direct experience of it.

View Initiative

View Initiative

Knight-Hennessy Scholars

—

In an era of increasingly complex global challenges, research universities are called to find new solutions to problems old and new and to educate courageous leaders who will forge collaborations and create change at scale.

View Initiative

Knight-Hennessy Scholars

—

In an era of increasingly complex global challenges, research universities are called to find new solutions to problems old and new and to educate courageous leaders who will forge collaborations and create change at scale.

View Initiative

Food, Nutrition and Rural Livelihoods Initiative

—

In-house research efforts led King Philanthropies to launch a new initiative in Food, Nutrition, and Rural Livelihoods, which brings tremendous opportunity for impact in extreme poverty alleviation.

View Initiative

Food, Nutrition and Rural Livelihoods Initiative

—

In-house research efforts led King Philanthropies to launch a new initiative in Food, Nutrition, and Rural Livelihoods, which brings tremendous opportunity for impact in extreme poverty alleviation.

View Initiative

Thrive Foundation For Youth

—

Over 15 years ago, Bob and Dottie King and their adult children agreed on their family’s philanthropic commitment to help youth to realize their full potential, or to “thrive.”

View Initiative
